Battering Ram.name: Battering Ram
Battering Ram.description: A prolonged piece of sturdy material usually attached low  to the bow of the ship to form a beak. The battering ram is designed to puncture the hulls of enemy ships during ram attacks.When you have the battering ram attached, your ship takes no damage after performing a successful ram attack, and only half of the targeted ships maximum hull points on an unsuccessful ram attack. In addition, as the attacking ship, you may choose to not be grappled following a ram attack. You may only have one ram equipped to your ship. The ram can only be equipped on the bow of the ship.

Fire Ram.name: Fire Ram
Fire Ram.description: A fire ram is a hollowed battering ram that can pump lit oil into the bowels of the rammed ship.Any target caught within this stream suffers 6d6 fire damage, or half that on a successful DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. In addition, a ship made of wood or another flammable material is set on fire. While on fire, the ship suffers 7 (2d6) fire damage at the start of its turn, and subsequent fire damage increases by 1d6. A crew member may spend their action to reduce the damage of the fire by 1d6. When the fire damage reaches 0, the fire is extinguished, and the ship no longer suffers fire damage at the start of its turn. The fire ram can be used three times before needed to refuel with Salamander fuel, which takes 10 minutes.

Grappling Ram.name: Grappling Ram
Grappling Ram.description: A grappling ram is a battering ram that has an extendable hook on the end. This allows the deployer to choose to grapple the rammed ship. You may only have one ram equipped to your ship.The ram can only be equipped on the bow of the ship.

Titan Blade (Small).name: Titan Blade (Small)
Titan Blade (Small).description: Titan blades are giant blades that can be set on the side of a ship and can reach out [half ship width] feet to slice through a nearby ship as you move alongside. The damage is depended on the size of your ship. The Titan Blade takes half the damage it has dealt. Titan blades can only be placed on the sides of the ship.

Swivel Cannon.name: Swivel Cannon
Swivel Cannon.description: This small cannon is placed on a swivel and is therefore not limited to its placed quadrant but can shoot anything within range that is not fully in cover.

Light Cannon.name: Light Cannon
Light Cannon.description: A light cannon. Easy to move but doesn't hit hard.

Falconet.name: Falconet
Falconet.description: A medium-light cannon. A standard in the medium class warships.

Culverine.name: Culverine
Culverine.description: A medium cannon. A standard in the large class warships.

Culverine Royale.name: Culverine Royale
Culverine Royale.description: A medium cannon. A high standard in the large class warships.

Heavy Cannon.name: Heavy Cannon
Heavy Cannon.description: A heavy cannon. A standard in the huge class warships.

Imperial Cannon.name: Imperial Cannon
Imperial Cannon.description: A masterwork heavy cannon. A high standard in the huge class warships.

Mortar.name: Mortar
Mortar.description: A long range hard-hitting cannon specialized in destroying buildings.

Howitzer.name: Howitzer
Howitzer.description: The improved version of the mortar.

Turret.name: Turret
Turret.description: This medium sized turret with two barrels fires automatically at nearby enemies twice a round with a +6 to hit. It can do 160 attacks before it needs to be reloaded which takes 4 Operate Crew actions. It fires Lever Action Rifle bullets (see Homebrew Firearms Guide).

Flaming Arrow.name: Flaming Arrow
Flaming Arrow.description: The flaming arrow shoots a flaming bolt setting the enemy ship on fire. It will set the target ship on fire if it is made of wood or another flammable material. At the start of the shipâ€™s turn, it suffers 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the fire spreads, causing subsequent fire damage to increase by another 1d6. Subsequent successful flaming bolt attacks also increase the fire damage by 1d6. A crew member may spend their action attempting to reduce the damage of the fire by 1d6. When the fire damage reaches 0, the fire is extinguished and the ship no longer suffers fire damage at the start of its turn.

Improved Flaming Arrow.name: Improved Flaming Arrow
Improved Flaming Arrow.description: The improved version of the flaming arrow. It sets the ship on firelike the Flaming Arrow but starting at3d6 fire damage. Increasing the fire damage by 2d6 for each subsequent successful flaming arrow attack.

Salamander.name: Salamander
Salamander.description: The salamander is a burning oil shooting weapon. A 30-foot cone of fire streams from the salamander. Any target caught within this stream suffers 28 (6d8) fire damage, or half that on a successful DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. In addition, a ship made of wood or another flammable material is set on fire. While on fire, the ship suffers 7 (2d6) fire damage at the start of its turn, and subsequent fire damage increases by 1d6. A crew member may spend their action to reduce the damage of the fire by 1d6. When the fire damage reaches 0, the fire is extinguished, and the ship no longer suffers fire damage at the start of its turn.The salamander can be used three times before needed to refuel, which takes 10 minutes.There can only be one Salamander or Dragon Head on the Bow of the ship. Salamanders explode doing its damage in a 30 radius when destroyed.

Dragon head.name: Dragon head
Dragon head.description: The improved version of the salamander. Increasing the DC to 16at a range of 45ft.. It also sets the ship on fire for 3d6 damage. Increasing the fire damage by 2d6 for each subsequent attack.The dragon head can be used three times before needed to refuel, which takes 10 minutes.There can only be one Salamander or Dragon Head on the Bow of the ship.Dragon Heads explode doing its damage in a 30 radius when destroyed.

Harpoon.name: Harpoon
Harpoon.description: The harpoon is a hooked bolt that is shot forward using gunpowder. It has a chain and automatically grapples a hit creature. The harpoon is strong enough for creatures size between Small and Huge.A chain can be broken by a grappled creature using an action, making a DC16 Strength check. A sailor can take an action on a harpoon to draw a creature in 20ft. when grappled. This can stack with multiple harpoons. Each harpoon launcher can only have one chain attached.

Ship Harpoon.name: Ship Harpoon
Ship Harpoon.description: So, what do you do when your harpooning target is a ship, or at least ship sized? You make your harpoon also that big. This harpoon has a heavy chain and automatically grapples a hit creature or ship. This harpoon is strong enough for creatures ranging from Hugeto Gargantuan. Anything smaller just gets squished. A sailor can take an action on a ship harpoon to draw a ship or creature in 20ft. when grappled. This can stack with multiple ship harpoons.Each ship harpoon launcher can only have one chain attached.

Creature Launcher.name: Creature Launcher
Creature Launcher.description: This unique cannon was created by a rather eccentric Gnomish laboratory and used only by those with a death wish. Instead of cannonballs or bolts, this unique cannon uses creatures as ammunition. With specialised internal mechanics, along with a few magically inscribed runes, the creature launcher is able to propel its living payload a great distance, mostly unharmed. In order to use it, a medium or smaller creature must spend at least half of their move speed to insert themselves into the creature launcher. Once loaded, another creature may use the Operate Crew Action on the creature launcher to fire the loaded creature at a point within range.The loaded creature is fired at a point within range. Upon a successful hit, the creature lands at the intended target. Upon a miss, the creature instead lands 1d100 feet away from its intended target. Determine the direction by rolling 1d8, with 1 being north, 2 being north-east, etc. Creatures launched from the creature launcher do not take fall damage due to a short-lived enchantment placed on them, but the force of the launch causes them to take 3d6 force damage.

Air Mine Deployer.name: Air Mine Deployer
Air Mine Deployer.description: This object is used to launch air mines into position. Mines can be found in the ammunition section of Chapter 6: Equipment.It can only be equipped on the stern of the ship.
